name: Audio Device Out CHOP
description:
The Audio Device Out CHOP sends audio to any of the attached audio output devices using DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO. 			
The second input on the Audio Device Out CHOP can be used for volume control.
summary:
The Audio Device Out CHOP sends audio to any of the attached audio output devices using DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO. 			
The second input on the Audio Device Out CHOP can be used for volume control.

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Audio Device Out  sends audio to any of the attached audio output devices using DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO. 			
The second input on the Audio Device Out  can be used for volume control.			
Tip: If you get audio popping or audio dropouts, it may be caused by your actual frame rate of your main timeline - some frames may take too long to compute/render. See Time Slicing. There are four possible remedies:			

The global  Maximum Time Slice Size may be shorter than your worst-case time steps. Its default is .2 seconds set in Edit -> Preferences -> CHOPs -> Maximum  Size). If any frame takes longer than the Maximum  Size time to draw, audio will pop.
Then the audio buffer size can be increased (the Buffer Length parameter defaults to .15 seconds) up to the Maximum  Size.
Optimize your networks so under no condition your frame time exceeds the audio buffer size or the maximum time slice size. You can monitor this precisely with the Perform CHOP.
Put audio in a separate TouchDesigner process.audiodeviceoutCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  active - Turns the audio output on or off.


		
  driver -  - Select between default DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO drivers.

 default - The default Windows audio driver (a.k.a. WDM) or macOS CoreAudio driver, depending on your OS. asio - Low-latency drivers which usually come from the hardware's manufacturer.
		
  device - A menu of available audio devices to output to. Selecting default sets the audio device to that which is selected in Windows >Sounds and Audio Devices>Audio>Sound Playback.



  errormissing - The  will error if the specified device is not found.



  outputs - When Driver is set to ASIO on Windows or CoreAudio on macOS, this parameter lets you pick which output channels to use.


		
  bufferlength - The length of the audio buffer in seconds. Audio output is delayed by this amount. For example, if the Buffer Length is 0.25 then the sound will occur 250ms = 0.25 seconds later than this  received it (to keep the buffer full). If you hear crackling or popping in the audio output, try increasing this value.


		
  volume - 0 = mute, 1 = full volume.


		
  pan - 0 = left, 0.5 = centered, 1 = right.


		
  clampoutput - Clamps the output between -1 and 1 to avoid clipping and overdriving of the audio system.


		
  cookalways - Forces the  to cook every frame. This should be checked on at all times when outputing audio. It can be turned off when the  is not in use.





When using DirectSound on Windows, outputs on this page and the following  page are for routing to an audio device's different speaker outputs. Not all devices will support all outputs.		
When the Audio Device Out  has multiple input channels, the channels are applied to the checked speaker outputs in order. The first input channel is output to the first speaker checked, the second input channel is output to the second speaker checked, and so on.			
The following speaker outputs are found on this parameter page:

  stereo - Set to simple stereo left/right output mode.



  frontleft - Enable this output if available.


		
  frontright - Enable this output if available.


		
  frontcenter - Enable this output if available.


		
  lowfrequency - Enable this output if available.


		
  backleft - Enable this output if available.


		
  backright - Enable this output if available.


		
  frontleftcenter - Enable this output if available.


		
  frontrightcenter - Enable this output if available.


		
  backcenter - Enable this output if available.





The following speaker outputs are found on this parameter page:

  sideleft - Enable this output if available.


		
  sideright - Enable this output if available.


		
  topcenter - Enable this output if available.


		
  topfrontleft - Enable this output if available.


		
  topfrontcenter - Enable this output if available.


		
  topfrontright - Enable this output if available.


		
  topbackleft - Enable this output if available.


		
  topbackcenter - Enable this output if available.


		
  topbackright - Enable this output if available.





  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





 -
 -

Extra Information for the Audio Device Out  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.


 - - - - -
 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2022.241402021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A custom interactive control panel built within TouchDesigner. Panels are created using Panel Components.



To re-compute the output data of the Operators. An operator cooks when (1) its inputs change, (2) its Parameters change, (3) when the timeline moves forward in some cases, or (4) Scripting commands are run on the node. When the operator is a Panel Component, it also cooks when a user interacts with it. When an operator cooks, it usually causes operators connected to its output to re-cook. When TouchDesigner draws the screen, it re-cooks all the Dependencies - the necessary operators in all Networks, contributing to a frame's total "cook time".



The term "Frame" is a measurement of time used (1) in the Timeline, (2) as a time-unit in CHOPs, and (3) as a time unit in movie files that are read into TOPs and written out from TOPs. The frame rate is the frames per second (FPS).



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Audio_Device_Out_CHOP&oldid=24453"
		Category: CHOPs

The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Audio_Device_Out_CHOP&oldid=24453"

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description: active - Turns the audio output on or off.

parameters.name: Driver
parameters.label: Driver
parameters.description:
driver -  - Select between default DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO drivers.

 default - The default Windows audio driver (a.k.a. WDM) or macOS CoreAudio driver, depending on your OS. asio - Low-latency drivers which usually come from the hardware's manufacturer.

parameters.name: DirectSound
parameters.label: DirectSound
parameters.description: default - The default Windows audio driver (a.k.a. WDM) or macOS CoreAudio driver, depending on your OS. asio - Low-latency drivers which usually come from the hardware's manufacturer.

parameters.name: Device
parameters.label: Device
parameters.description: device - A menu of available audio devices to output to. Selecting default sets the audio device to that which is selected in Windows >Sounds and Audio Devices>Audio>Sound Playback.

parameters.name: Error if Missing
parameters.label: Error if Missing
parameters.description: errormissing - The  will error if the specified device is not found.

parameters.name: Outputs
parameters.label: Outputs
parameters.description: outputs - When Driver is set to ASIO on Windows or CoreAudio on macOS, this parameter lets you pick which output channels to use.

parameters.name: Buffer Length
parameters.label: Buffer Length
parameters.description: bufferlength - The length of the audio buffer in seconds. Audio output is delayed by this amount. For example, if the Buffer Length is 0.25 then the sound will occur 250ms = 0.25 seconds later than this  received it (to keep the buffer full). If you hear crackling or popping in the audio output, try increasing this value.

parameters.name: Volume
parameters.label: Volume
parameters.description: volume - 0 = mute, 1 = full volume.

parameters.name: Pan
parameters.label: Pan
parameters.description: pan - 0 = left, 0.5 = centered, 1 = right.

parameters.name: Clamp Output
parameters.label: Clamp Output
parameters.description: clampoutput - Clamps the output between -1 and 1 to avoid clipping and overdriving of the audio system.

parameters.name: Cook Every Frame
parameters.label: Cook Every Frame
parameters.description: cookalways - Forces the  to cook every frame. This should be checked on at all times when outputing audio. It can be turned off when the  is not in use.

parameters.name: Stereo Mode
parameters.label: Stereo Mode
parameters.description: stereo - Set to simple stereo left/right output mode.

parameters.name: Front Left
parameters.label: Front Left
parameters.description: frontleft - Enable this output if available.

parameters.name: Front Right
parameters.label: Front Right
parameters.description: frontright - Enable this output if available.

parameters.name: Front Center
parameters.label: Front Center
parameters.description: frontcenter - Enable this output if available.

parameters.name: Low Frequency
parameters.label: Low Frequency
parameters.description: lowfrequency - Enable this output if available.

parameters.label: Back Left
parameters.description: backleft - Enable this output if available.

parameters.label: Back Right
parameters.description: backright - Enable this output if available.

parameters.label: Front Left of Center
parameters.description: frontleftcenter - Enable this output if available.

parameters.description: frontrightcenter - Enable this output if available.

parameters.description: backcenter - Enable this output if available.

parameters.description: sideleft - Enable this output if available.

parameters.name: Side Right

parameters.description: topcenter - Enable this output if available.

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
